text: Megaman is pretty spare on the cheapness. Bosses have predictable patterns (with notable exceptions, like the Yellow Devil), enemies are never too fast, and all spike traps always come after a screen transition so you have time to steer Megaman in another direction (they ended up being mostly discontinued after MM2 anyway). It's not like every stage is filled with Quick Man beams, for instance.

text:
You pick up a  new game today. Your friend said it was the hardest game you have ever played. You play it. It was tough, but you still beat it halfway into the following week. Now you go to your friend. You give him your old NES system and a copy of Ninja gaiden, saying it was the hardest game you have ever played. He plays it. 2 months pass since you lend it to him, and he says that he is still stuck on act 3.
As for me, I can't beat the final Boss.

text:
It took me 3 years of playing every day to complete this game... (Every day I would play until act 6-2, which after a while only took 10-15 minutes to get to). Until one day.... I finally did it.... I was so proud.
